emuInput.TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Pirates baseball team manager Fred Haney posing with Birmingham Black Barons player Dwight Smallwood, at Forbes Field
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 22, 1954, pg. 26, reads: "Haney Greets Ex-Baron - Manager Fred Haney, left, is seen extending a warm welcome to Dwight Smallwood, sensational centerfielder of the Birmingham Black Barons, who has signed a contract to play in the farm team organization of the Pittsburgh Pirates.  Smallwood is not yet 21 years of age, so the club was forced to have the youngster's father sign the new contact.  Willie Mays, the New York Giants' ace gardener, started his career with the Black Barons, also. - Harris Photo."
